column6: | Support for RDNSS option as of 15.4(1)T 15.3(2)S.
| Devices can only carry / pass through IPv6 on bridge but not route
| RDNSS support with "rdnssd" and "resolvconf" or "openresolve" packages.
| LibreELEC uses [https://01.org/connman connman] which does not have full IPv6 support.
| Versions 10.7 through 10.10 often prefer IPv4 even when working IPv6 connectivity is available.
| RDNSS is only supported for rad(8) so far. As of 6.6 OpenBSD still does not favor IPv6 connectivity if there is IPv4 connectivity.{{Citation needed|date=June 2020}}
| Though ReactOS itself has no IPv6 support [https://reactos.org/wiki/IPv6 ReactOS Foundation services are all IPv6 enabled].
| RDNSS support available so long as NetworkManager uses IPv6 "Automatic" setting otherwise "rdnssd" package required.
| Windows XP users can use Dibbler an open source DHCPv6 implementation. --update: Windows XP fully supports IPv6- but NOT IPv6 DNS queries (nslookup)

column5: | dnssd-win32 provides an open source implementation of ND RDNSS
| Windows 10 Creators Update introduces support for RFC 8106 (6106) RDNSS.

column6: | If the OEM explicitly unsets the '''SYSGEN_TCPIP6''' pre-processor symbol the built image will not have any IPv6 capabilities.

column5: | Private lab research. No privacy extensions (RFC4941).

column6: | Via a third party TCP/IP stack IP6/VSE from Barnard Software Inc.
